alert.note: Alert for Northeast Aroostook; Northwest Aroostook (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 13 at 1:28PM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...An area of heavy snow showers will affect northeastern Aroostook County... At 128 PM EST...An area of heavy snow showers was along a line extending from near Lille to near Cross Lake to 7 miles east of Allagash...and moving east AT 40 MPH. Locations impacted include... Caribou, Madawaska, Limestone, Van Buren, Eagle Lake, New Canada, Lille, Cross Lake, Loring, Madawaska Lake, New Sweden, Wallagrass, Grand Isle, Connor, Caswell, Stockholm, Hamlin, Westmanland, Sinclair, and Soldier Pond. This includes the following highways... US Highway 1 near Van Buren. State Highway 11 near Wallagrass. * Winds in excess of 25 mph are possible with this area of heavy snow showers. * Visibilities will drop quickly to less than a half mile in this area of heavy snow showers. To report impactful winter weather, contact the National Weather Service office in Caribou, by calling 1-800-909- 5970 or visit https://inws.ncep.noaa.gov/report. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time when traveling.
